Study in Turkey with EduCrest Migration

Are you considering studying abroad? If so, studying in Turkey is an excellent option, especially for Pakistani students. With its unique blend of history, culture, and educational excellence, Turkey has emerged as a leading destination for international students. With a 90% Muslim population, Turkey offers a welcoming environment, complete with nationwide availability of halal food. Over 200 Turkish universities provide admissions in diverse programs, including Medicine, Engineering, Information Technology, and Computer Sciences. Both partially and fully funded scholarships are available, primarily merit-based, though they come with strong competition. Moreover, part-time work is also allowed.


Benefits of Studying in Turkey

Low Tuition Fees and Affordable Living Costs

Turkey offers an excellent opportunity to pursue higher education at a low cost. Annual tuition fees at public universities range between $2,000 and $7,000, which is significantly more affordable than Western countries. Additionally, living expenses, including food, accommodation, and transportation, are budget-friendly. Their average monthly cost falls between €400 and €650. Moreover, students can work part-time for up to 24 hours per week after completing their year.

Quality Education with Global Recognition

Turkey is home to globally recognized institutions such as Ankara University, Middle East Technical University (METU), and Istanbul University, known for delivering high-quality education. Many Turkish universities offer English-taught programs, ensuring students can study without language barriers. Furthermore, Turkey provides numerous partially and fully funded scholarships specifically designed for international students, making quality education more accessible and affordable.

Strategic Location and Cultural Familiarity

Turkey’s unique geographical position, bridging Europe and Asia, makes it a gateway to both regions. Pakistani students can easily explore opportunities for internships, jobs, or networking across Europe and the Middle East. Cultural familiarity also plays a significant role in helping Pakistani students settle comfortably in Turkey. With both nations sharing a predominantly Muslim culture, the availability of halal food, religious practices, and customs ensures a welcoming environment.

The Process of Studying in Turkey with EduCrest Hub

At EduCrest Migration, we are the leading study abroad consultancy in Islamabad, specializing in helping Pakistani students study in Turkey. Our team of expert education consultants for Turkey provides personalized guidance, ensuring that each student receives the right advice and support throughout their application process. We make your path to studying in Turkey smooth, efficient, and stress-free. Here’s how we assist you at every step of your journey

  • Student Counselling
  • Application Processing
  • Turkey Student Visa
  • Interview Preparation

Student Counselling

Choosing the right university and program is a critical first step in your academic journey. At EduCrest Migration, we provide expert student counselling to help you make the best choice based on your academic background, interests, and career ambitions. We guide you in selecting from a variety of programs, whether you want to study engineering, computer sciences, medicine, or other disciplines.

Application Processing

Our best education consultants for Turkey help you with every step of the application processing, ensuring that you meet all university-specific requirements, including documentation, transcripts, and other prerequisites. We provide detailed advice on how to strengthen your application, making sure your personal statement, SOP, and CV are compelling. We guide you on how to meet each university’s deadlines, ensuring that you submit everything on time and maximize your chances of acceptance.

Turkey Student Visa

Securing a Turkey student visa is often one of the most daunting parts of studying abroad, but with EduCrest Migration, the process becomes much easier. Our study consultants in Islamabd assist you in gathering and preparing all the required documents for your visa application, including proof of admission to a Turkish university, a valid passport, and a bank statement showing sufficient funds to cover your tuition and living expenses. EduCrest Migration ensures that your visa application is complete and accurate, minimizing the chances of delays or rejection.

Interview Preparation

For many students, an interview is part of the visa application process or a requirement for admission to certain programs. EduCrest Migration offers tailored interview preparation to help you perform your best. Our consultants will walk you through common interview questions related to your motivation for studying in Turkey, your academic background, and your future plans. We provide mock interview sessions to build your confidence and improve your communication skills, helping you to present yourself in the best possible light. Our goal is to ensure that you feel confident and ready for any interview you may face during the application process.

Why Choose EduCrest Migration as Your Study Abroad Consultancy?

EduCrest Migration is known as one of the best study consultants in Islamabad, specializing in providing expert advice and services to Pakistani students wishing to study in Turkey. Our team of expert consultants is well-versed in the Turkish education system and can guide you through every step of the process. From university selection to visa applications, accommodation, and post-arrival support, we offer a full range of services to ensure your success. Moreover, we understand that each student is unique. That’s why we offer personalized support tailored to your specific academic and career goals. Our clients have consistently secured placements in top universities in Turkey, and our services are trusted by many students across Islamabad and Pakistan.

  • Document Check

Surprising Facts About Turkey for Students

Every year, over 220,000 international students choose to study in Turkey, attracted by its world-class education, rich cultural heritage, and strategic location. Turkey is home to 183 higher education institutions, including 109 state universities and 74 private non-profit institutions, providing a wide range of academic programs for students. Notably, two Turkish universities were ranked in the 2022 QS World University Rankings within the top 600, highlighting the country’s commitment to high-quality education.

Turkey offers a unique blend of Eastern and Western educational traditions, making it an ideal destination for students seeking diverse academic experiences. Aside from academics, students can enjoy the country’s historical sites, including two of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World—the Temple of Artemis and the Mausoleum at Halicarnassus. Whether you’re pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree, studying in Turkey means you can balance your academic life with the opportunity to explore historical landmarks like the Archaeological Site of Troy or the Rock Sites of Cappadocia.

Admission Requirements to Study in Turkey

To apply for your studies in Turkey, you will need the following documents:

1.      National Identity Card:  A valid Pakistani National ID card for identification

2.      Valid Passport: Your passport must be valid for at least 90 days after your planned arrival in Turkey.

3.      Attested Academic Transcripts: Official transcripts from your previous academic institutions, attested as required.

4.      Updated CV or Resume: A recent CV detailing your academic and professional background.

5.      English Proficiency Certificate: IELTS, TOEFL, or another certificate of English proficiency, as per university requirements.

6.      University Scholarship Letter: If applying for a scholarship, you need a letter confirming it.

7.      2 Recommendation Letters: Letters from academic or professional referees supporting your application.

8.      Statement of Purpose: A personal statement explaining your academic and career goals.

9.      Application Fee Receipt (35-100 USD): Proof of payment of the application fee.

VISA Requirements to Study in Turkey

Getting a Turkey student visa is important to study in Turkey. Without a valid visa, students will not be able to enter or study in Turkey. The visa process can be challenging due to the various requirements and documentation needed, making it difficult for many students to navigate on their own. However, with the support of EduCrest Migration, a leading study abroad consultancy in Islamabad, Pakistani students can easily streamline this process. EduCrest Migration, with its extensive experience in dealing with student visas, offers expert guidance to ensure that your visa application is complete and meets all the requirements. Our team will assist you in gathering all necessary documents, ensuring that your application is not delayed or rejected. We are here to help you every step of the way, from filling out the application form to ensuring your documents are in order for submission.

Here are the key visa requirements for studying in Turkey:
To study in Turkey, here are the documents you’ll need:
  1. Visa Application Form: Complete the visa application form, which can be obtained from the Turkish Embassy or Consulate. EduCrest Migration can guide you on how to fill out the form accurately.
  2. Visa Fee Receipt (60-100 USD): Pay the required visa application fee, which ranges between 60 to 100 USD . We will guide you through the payment process and ensure you have proof of payment for your application.
  3. Valid Passport (At least 90 days validity): Your passport must be valid for at least 90 days beyond your intended arrival date in Turkey.
  4. Acceptance Letter from Turkish University: You must provide an official acceptance letter from the Turkish university where you have been admitted. EduCrest Migration will help ensure that your acceptance letter is correctly formatted and meets embassy standards. We enhance your chances to grab an offer letter and study in Turkey to 100%.
  5. Medical Insurance: A valid medical insurance covering your stay in Turkey is required. We will assist you in finding the best options for international student health coverage.
  6. Academic Transcripts: Submit your official academic transcripts from your previous institution to prove your academic background. EduCrest Migration will help you gather and authenticate these documents.
  7. Passport-Sized Photographs: Provide 2-3 passport-sized photographs as per the Turkish Embassy’s specifications. EduCrest Migration will help you with photo requirements.
  8. Bank Statement (7000 Euros): A bank statement showing a balance of at least 7000 Euros is required to prove that you have sufficient funds to cover your tuition and living expenses. EduCrest Migration will assist you in understanding the exact requirements for this document.
  9. Additional Documents (If Applicable):
  • • Scholarship Award Letter if applicable, showing any scholarship offers from Turkish universities.
  • • English Proficiency Certificate (IELTS/TOEFL) as required by your chosen university.
  • • Receipt of paid application fee (35-100 USD) for university admission.

Top Universities to Study in Turkey

Turkey is home to many prestigious universities that offer high-quality education, diverse academic programs, and cutting-edge research opportunities. International students flock to these institutions for both the academic excellence and cultural richness that Turkey offers. Below is a list of some of the top universities in Turkey:

  • • Bogazici University – Istanbul
  • • Istanbul University – Istanbul
  • • Middle East Technical University (METU) – Ankara
  • • Istanbul Technical University (ITU) – Istanbul
  • • Bilkent University – Ankara
  • • Koc University – Istanbul
  • • Sabanci University – Istanbul
  • • Ankara University – Ankara
  • • Ege University – Izmir
  • • Hacettepe University – Ankara
  • • Anadolu University – Eskisehir

These universities offer a wide variety of undergraduate, graduate, and PhD programs, providing international students with an excellent opportunity for academic and personal growth.

Living Costs in Turkey

The cost of living for Pakistani students who want to study in Turkey, is relatively affordable compared to many Western countries. The average monthly expense ranges between 400-650 USD, depending on lifestyle and location. Here’s an approximate breakdown:

Expense Estimated Cost
Monthly Rent 190 USD (for a 1-bedroom apartment)
Utilities 65 USD/month
Public Transport Pass 37 USD/month
Normal One-Time Meal 4.10 USD
Coffee 2 USD
Internet and Miscellaneous Expenses 100 USD/month

Additional Notes

  • • Accommodation: Rent can vary depending on the city. Major cities like Istanbul and Ankara may have higher rental costs, but they also offer more student accommodation options.
  • • Part-Time Work: International students can work part-time (24 hours/week), helping to cover living expenses while studying in Turkey.
  • • Health Insurance: It is mandatory for international students to have health insurance in Turkey. This can be arranged either through Turkish social security or private providers.

Part-time Working Hours and After Study Work Permit

Pakistani students studying in Turkey can work part-time while pursuing their education. They can work for up to 24 hours per week during the academic year. However, it is important to obtain a work permit from the relevant authorities before starting any employment. This allows students to gain valuable work experience while studying, helping them financially and professionally.

Additionally, after completing their education in Turkey, students have the opportunity to apply for an after-study work permit. This permit allows graduates to stay in Turkey for up to one year after graduation, providing time to search for full-time employment or pursue further studies. On average, part-time students in Turkey earn around 500-700 USD per month, which helps cover living expenses and enriches their overall experience.

Apply Now with EduCrest Migration!

Ready to take the next step in your academic journey? Contact EduCrest Migration, the study in Turkey consultants, and let us help you achieve your dream of studying abroad. Our team of experts is here to assist with every detail: from university selection to obtaining your Turkey student visa. Let us guide you toward a brighter future with the best education in Turkey.
